cardhead: 
Sorry if I threaten you, or if you took offense to my post (since i 
regret some of what i wrote now...), but your first line of that ooC 
a while back when you were replying to Azure's comments was a 
little... well, I didn't like it too much (the yapping part). It 
could have been put a little more politely perhaps. 

I don't feel I was pointing in the wrong direction (not sure what I 
was pointing at either), and nor do I expect you to get the RPG 
right away. I also didn't automatically know everything about your 
weapon. I understand the function of the weapon based upon what you 
wrote earlier. My post was more refering to what was said in the 
upper paragraph of this post. 

I wasn't intending to say that your weapon wasn't appropriate for 
the rpg. I did speak my mind saying that perhaps a reduced number of 
shots was preferable after reading your suggestion that you would 
fire it at a rate of 2 shells per post. The whole misunderstanding 
started by me forgetting to bring up rule changes to the rest of the 
council to be reviewed.

I'm not sure I fully understood the attitude/new guy comment.

How would you prepare yourself for new people who come in with lots 
of new ideas? If our system is lacking, I want to use your knowledge.

There are 3 moderators because we're human, and are quite capable of 
mistakes.

aerosmith: 
I don't believe that I said 'don't post while I am gone' (though my 
mistake if it seemed like it). I was suggesting that it would be 
more logicial and reasonable if when in battle, people regulated 
their posting frequency so that everyone fights the battle, not just 
a few people. =)

off topic, now that Galvatron is present, is he going to be a loner? 
or is he going to join the Predacons?

Kyle: 
Ya, it was more like 4-5 days at a minimum. 
Where exactly are you coming from? If a moderator didn't have power, 
would that person really be a moderator? I'm wrong quite often, and 
I have openly admitted it. There are however, occasions when I don't 
believe that I'm wrong, and therefore I won't admit to being wrong.

--------------------------

*sigh* the criticism that comes with being a moderator is 
unquestionably considerable. Too bad I'm not perfect.


> Whoah, way to point your finger in the wrong direction.  The only 
> posts I made that had anything to do with the battle in the last 
> couple of days were to clarify the weapon's function.  It's not 
like 
> I kept shooting!  Jeez, just because you're a mod doesn't mean you 
> automatically know everything about a weapon someone else designed.
> 
> I'm not here to stand around and look pretty either.  If anyone 
needs 
> an attitude change, it's the people who expect the new guy to not 
> know shit about how RPGs work.  I've had a ton of writing and 
> roleplaying experience, thank you very much, and I know what I'm 
> doing.
> 
> You ought to be a little more prepared for those who show up with 
a 
> slew of ideas ready beforehand.  I'm not saying all my ideas 
should 
> go through, I'm saying I have them ready for when there's an 
opening.
